commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hi! Everyone here?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hi, Ai.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Kasumi brought some home-made bread today!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: What?! Awesome! If it's from the Kas, there's no way I can pass!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Don't call me names just to make a pun!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Guys, I finally got an impression for this song. Want to hear it?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You already finished the song? Oh, I'd love to hear it!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: From mad to lovey in a split second.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Sometimes I think Kasumi would be a natural acting on stage, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So, what do you think?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Sounds great!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I can't wait to sing it! Rina-chan Board says, "Woo-hoo!"

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I love it!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, it was amazing!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It felt like I could see everyone while I listened to it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks! There are still a few areas I need to work on.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: You said μ's and Aqours write songs like this, right? How was it, witnessing it up close?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I'd love to hear about that, too. I haven't heard anything about the Numazu festival or your interviews with μ's.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Actually, none of us have. We'd love to hear all about it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: About μ's and Aqours? Hm, let me see... When I went to Uchiura, Riko was the first person I met.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: She was staring out at the ocean on the shore and I mistakenly thought she might do something stupid.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The first thing I said to her was 'Don't do it!'

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Didn't that surprise her?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It did! I didn't realize it was the Riko from Aqours at first though.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: When I told her I came there to see Aqours, she led me to Chika's place.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: So that's how you got to talking about helping with the festival?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah! Everyone was so easy to talk to. It was amazing. They were getting ready for the festival and practicing regularly, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: They choreographed the Bon dance and even thought up the menu for the food carts. Isn't that amazing?!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: That is amazing. So what did you help with?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I actually didn't help that much. Oh. But there was one thing. They used my idea for dessert.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: It's good that the festival you all worked so hard on didn't get ruined by the typhoon.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: If it weren't for Aqours' hard work, it might have gotten canceled. They're amazing for being able to enjoy such challenges.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The festival was a big success, so they might do it next year, too.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I'm going to save my allowance and go. If things go well, maybe I'll be on the stage. Hehehe.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: What about your interviews with μ's?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I heard a lot of things from them for the interviews, but it was all so shocking to me at the time.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Aqours decided on their new song's theme together and discussed their thoughts.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: μ's didn't do that at all, and just talked about what kind of show they wanted to do.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You would think they'd narrow down ideas by deciding on a theme, or costumes, or even choreography, right?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Um, like if you make it a winter theme then everything would be snowy and white, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. If the theme was already winter, you wouldn't suggest swimsuits as costumes, right? It makes brainstorming go smoothly. μ's was so free about it though.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It was funny how Honoka always said something ridiculous and them Umi would yell at her for it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Maki's song writing was similar. I told you about it before, but Hanayo and Rin would sing to her piano about how hungry they were while she played, and she'd get mad.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It's surprising how they can put on a concert so good with those kind of methods.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: But when we did those contests against them, they were just high school girls like us.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: They seemed like they just loved having fun.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I'm sure they just looked like they were playing around, but were actually being serious. But everyone was just playing when we had that contest, right?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I think that kind of thing is perfect for μ's.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: So μ's has their own way and Aqours has theirs.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: So that means Nijigasaki needs our own way, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's what I think. So, I want everyone to work together and find out what our way is!

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Okay!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's why I wanted to talk with everyone while playing today, and it was way better than trying to write by myself.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Talking with everyone about all your opinions and stuff made me see how much I love you guys. It brings about so many ideas.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I played around with the idea I had the other day. I think it's perfect for everyone now. Have a listen.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Wow... It's amazing! I liked the one before, but I like this one even better!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes. It sounds like OUR song.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: The chorus conveys how I feel perfectly.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I like the first part of the A melody the best. It's so moving.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Are you some kind of wizard? That was everything I wanted in a song.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I feel the same way. It nearly made me cry.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Yeah, it's such an empowering song.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I can put exactly what I feel right into it.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: It's a song that brings all of our feelings together!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks guys! I'm so glad to hear that!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Great. Everyone feels like this is our song. I can't wait to see everyone perform it on stage.)

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Hm? What's this... Huh?!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Everyone, listen! We've got a big problem on our hands!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: What's wrong, Setsu?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It looks like...the School Idol Festival has been canceled!

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Whaaaat?!
